subject: Climate & Environment
title: Fixing Leaky Pipes
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Fixing Leaky Pipes.

hook.text: In many cities, 30-50% of treated water leaks out of old pipes before reaching a tap.

buildup.text: London loses 630 million liters of water per day to leaks in its Victorian-era mains.

discovery.text: Smart sensors can now detect leaks by listening for changes in pipe vibrations.

twist.text: Fixing leaks is often cheaper than building new water sources â€” but politically less exciting.

climax.text: Tokyo reduced its leak rate from 15% to under 3% through systematic pipe replacement.

punchline.text: The cheapest new water source is the water you stop wasting.
